text:
Hi I'm Sandia Chang from Bubbledogs
and today we're gonna make a Chinese

version of spaghetti and meatballs. Today
we're using pork as a base of our

meatballs, we're also adding Lee Kum Kee
Premium Oyster Sauce to give it that
extra layer of comfort and umami.
First we're gonna mix the pork

Then we're gonna put the scallions and ginger into
the bowl.
Now we're going to put in the breadcrumbs, then the sugar

then we're
gonna put in the rice wine, then a
tablespoon of corn starch.

So we're going
to put three whole eggs into this

meatball mixture so the eggs will give
it a nice juicy firm texture as well, and
eggs are good for you.

There you go now we're gonna add in the
Lee Kum Kee sauces, first we're gonna add
in this Premium Dark Soy Sauce.
Next, we're gonna add in the Lee Kum Kee

Premium Oyster Sauce; Oyster Sauce adds a
lovely touch of sweetness and also a
more depth of flavor to the dish.

Lastly
the Lee Kum Kee Double Deluxe Soy Sauce,

this really adds that extra depth of
flavor to the meatballs.
All right let's mix.

Smells amazing!
So now we can form meatballs.
Just make sure they're nice and round.
Now about a tablespoon of oil. Once the oil has come

up to the right temperature you can
start frying the meatballs.

So what you want is a nice even brown color on all
sides of the meatballs,

So once you're all golden brown on all sides we can
take it out and set it on the side.

Okay so now we're gonna do the sauce for the
spaghetti.
First we're gonna cut some onions and garlic

So we heat up our sauce pots about
medium heat and we're gonna put about a

tablespoon of vegetable oil in the pan.
I'm just gonna let the oil come up to

the right temperature. So first we sauté
the onions and the garlic what this does

is adds a great base of flavoring for
the sauce. Just let it sauté for a few

minutes until you really start smelling
the beautiful aromas of the garlic and

the onions in there we can add in our
Lee Kum Kee Double Deluxe Soy Sauce and

then our Lee Kum Kee Premium Oyster
Sauce.
This is what adds the really great

depth of flavors to the spaghetti sauce.
You let that cook a little bit about a

minute on super low heat now we're ready
to put the tomatoes in.

Give it a nice stir and now we're just
gonna let this simmer for about 20

minutes on low heat. I've got a water
here on boil just pop your pasta in.

While that is cooking we can put in our
meatballs into the pasta sauce.

Give that a little stir and we're gonna let this
simmer for about 15 minutes. So once the
pasta is done we're just gonna strain it.

I'm just gonna ladle nice big heaps of
the sauce on top of the pasta.

So there you go
Chinese Spaghetti and Meatballs.
